cast.name: 拉莉萨·鲁斯纳克 Larysa Rusnak

introduction: During 1944–1946 more than 480,000 Ukrainians had been forced to leave the territory of modern northeastern Poland — Kholmshchyna, Nadsiannia, Pidliashshia, and Lemkivshchyna. The eyewitness tells the story of deportation and recalls terrible conditions in which she and other Ukrainians were taken from Poland to the Ukrainian Soviet Socialist Republic.
